file_content.text: My Master said you came through in the clutch. House Organa owes you one.
Get the codes from the Ulgo camps and bring them to Selia Antares.
Anything wrong? Did you lose your master or something?
Hey! I'm here on my Master's orders. She sent me to get help. Name's C6-N8.
Look, I ain't got much time. So I gotta know--you interested in helping me out, or what?
Most protocol droids are a little more formal in their language.
You're a funny droid.
My Master didn't want no prissy, namby-pamby protocol droid working for her. So she reprogrammed me.
Try being nicer.
Lose the attitude, first.
My Master's in trouble, so I'll say whatever I gotta say. Please? Pretty please? Pretty please with sugar on top?
Your Master's in trouble?
I work for a mechanic at one of the House Organa outposts. Ulgo saboteurs snuck in, planted explosives on the primary transport ship.
That ship tries to take off, and we got pieces of the crew scattered all over the countryside.
I'm not a bomb tech.
We ain't trying to disarm it. My Master found a kill trigger. Fiddle with the setup, and it blows.
What's the problem? You know the explosives are there. Just remove them.
So disarm the bomb.
It ain't that easy. Master found a kill trigger. One wrong move and boom!
How can I help?
How can I help?
The only safe way to disarm the bombs is to get the deactivation codes from Ulgo's war camps.
Only they ain't handing the codes over just 'cause we asked. It's going to get messy. That's where you come in.
I could be persuaded to help.
You see any pockets on me? You want a reward, you talk to my Master.
Get the codes from the Ulgo camps and bring them to the House Organa outpost.
Give them to Selia Antares. Can't miss her. Prettiest gal around. And I wasn't just programmed to say so.
Forget it. [Refuse quest]
If you ain't gonna help, then shove off.
Can't talk. Busy.
You came to the right girl.
You came to the right guy.
